column1: An erupting volcano, far in the distance.
A spectacular lightning storm, illuminating an apocalyptic landscape.
Two different lava flows, meeting and merging into a wide slow-flowing river of molten rock.
Large boulders falling from a mountain and splashing into a lake of lava.
A rare bout of rain, sizzling a recent lava flow, hardening it and creating huge steam clouds.
A large pool of bubbly molten metal.
Ancient metal archways, the remains of an old lava tunnel that passed through and melted an iron vein.
A lava “waterfall,” dripping from a mile-high volcano.
A field of lava geysers, each creating a column of fire dozens of feet tall.
